comments.html:
This is great. Its nice to see useful things from the PIX world making their way into IOS. This feaure saved me a lot of time when I was administering PIX boxes.

gary
comments.name: Anonymous

comments.html:
object groups are nice, however they do not work if you use the object group acl with "line vty access-class in", or with -self- zone based firewalls.

IOS 12.4(22)T
comments.name: Anonymous

comments.html:
One more thing about object groups: they are saved in the config file in alphabetical order. This creates some problems when you use nested object groups. Let me explain:

first, you create an object group called BBB

object-group network BBB
host 1.2.3.4

then you create another object group called AAA, that contains reference to BBB

object-group network AAA
group-object BBB

This works OKAY, however after you save the configuration, you will notice that AAA object group apears first in the configuration file, like this:

object-group network AAA
group-object BBB

object-group network BBB
host 1.2.3.4


This is wrong, because during router reboot, the object AAA will be defined before object BBB, thus you will have some errors on the console, and your config will not work as expected...
comments.name: Anonymous

comments.html: Then maybe you want to prefix the object-group name with a number, like 1_bbb, 2_aaa.
comments.name: Anonymous
